title: Day 1: Introduction to the CCR, and to R
text: Variables Vectors Special values – NA Functions data.frame Packages Use install.packages() install CRAN packages First install BiocManager CRAN, use BiocManager::install() install Bioconductor packages.
code: 1 + 2 #> [1] 3 pie <- "apple" pie #> [1] "apple" pi #> [1] 3.141593 1:3 #> [1] 1 2 3 id <- 1:3 month <- c("Jan", "Feb", "Mar") sex <- factor(     c("Male", "Female", "Male"),     levels = c("Female", "Male") ) id > 1 #> [1] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE id[id > 1] #> [1] 2 3 age <- c(27, NA, 32) age > 27 #> [1] FALSE    NA  TRUE age[age > 27] #> [1] NA 32 sqrt(id) #> [1] 1.000000 1.414214 1.732051 df <- data.frame(     id = id,     month = month,     sex = sex ) df[df$sex == "Male",] #>   id month  sex #> 1  1   Jan Male #> 3  3   Mar Male

title: Day 1: Introduction to the CCR, and to R
code: library(readr) library(dplyr) all_file <- file.choose() all <- read_csv(all_file) all #> # A tibble: 128 × 21 #>    cod   diagnosis sex     age BT    remission CR    date.cr `t(4;11)` `t(9;22)` #>    <chr> <chr>     <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr>     <chr> <chr>   <lgl>     <lgl>     #>  1 1005  5/21/1997 M        53 B2    CR        CR    8/6/19… FALSE     TRUE      #>  2 1010  3/29/2000 M        19 B2    CR        CR    6/27/2… FALSE     FALSE     #>  3 3002  6/24/1998 F        52 B4    CR        CR    8/17/1… NA        NA        #>  4 4006  7/17/1997 M        38 B1    CR        CR    9/8/19… TRUE      FALSE     #>  5 4007  7/22/1997 M        57 B2    CR        CR    9/17/1… FALSE     FALSE     #>  6 4008  7/30/1997 M        17 B1    CR        CR    9/27/1… FALSE     FALSE     #>  7 4010  10/30/19… F        18 B1    CR        CR    1/7/19… FALSE     FALSE     #>  8 4016  2/10/2000 M        16 B1    CR        CR    4/17/2… FALSE     FALSE     #>  9 6002  3/19/1997 M        15 B2    CR        CR    6/9/19… FALSE     FALSE     #> 10 8001  1/15/1997 M        40 B2    CR        CR    3/26/1… FALSE     FALSE     #> # ℹ 118 more rows #> # ℹ 11 more variables: cyto.normal <lgl>, citog <chr>, mol.biol <chr>, #> #   `fusion protein` <chr>, mdr <chr>, kinet <chr>, ccr <lgl>, relapse <lgl>, #> #   transplant <lgl>, f.u <chr>, `date last seen` <chr> glimpse(all) #> Rows: 128 #> Columns: 21 #> $ cod              <chr> "1005", "1010", "3002", "4006", "4007", "4008", "4010… #> $ diagnosis        <chr> "5/21/1997", "3/29/2000", "6/24/1998", "7/17/1997", "… #> $ sex              <chr> "M", "M", "F", "M", "M", "M", "F", "M", "M", "M", "M"… #> $ age              <dbl> 53, 19, 52, 38, 57, 17, 18, 16, 15, 40, 33, 55, 5, 18… #> $ BT               <chr> "B2", "B2", "B4", "B1", "B2", "B1", "B1", "B1", "B2",… #> $ remission        <chr> "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR",… #> $ CR               <chr> "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR",… #> $ date.cr          <chr> "8/6/1997", "6/27/2000", "8/17/1998", "9/8/1997", "9/… #> $ `t(4;11)`        <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, NA, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, F… #> $ `t(9;22)`        <lgl> TRUE, FALSE, NA, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, F… #> $ cyto.normal      <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, NA, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, … #> $ citog            <chr> "t(9;22)", "simple alt.", NA, "t(4;11)", "del(6q)", "… #> $ mol.biol         <chr> "BCR/ABL", "NEG", "BCR/ABL", "ALL1/AF4", "NEG", "NEG"… #> $ `fusion protein` <chr> "p210", NA, "p190", NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, "p190", "… #> $ mdr              <chr> "NEG", "POS", "NEG", "NEG", "NEG", "NEG", "POS", "NEG… #> $ kinet            <chr> "dyploid", "dyploid", "dyploid", "dyploid", "dyploid"… #> $ ccr              <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALS… #> $ relapse          <lgl> FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE… #> $ transplant       <lgl> TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE… #> $ f.u              <chr> "BMT / DEATH IN CR", "REL", "REL", "REL", "REL", "REL… #> $ `date last seen` <chr> NA, "8/28/2000", "10/15/1999", "1/23/1998", "11/4/199…

title: Day 2: Data Management, Statistical Analysis, and Visualization
code: library(readr) library(dplyr) all_file <- file.choose() all <- read_csv(all_file) glimpse(all) #> Rows: 128 #> Columns: 21 #> $ cod              <chr> "1005", "1010", "3002", "4006", "4007", "4008", "4010… #> $ diagnosis        <chr> "5/21/1997", "3/29/2000", "6/24/1998", "7/17/1997", "… #> $ sex              <chr> "M", "M", "F", "M", "M", "M", "F", "M", "M", "M", "M"… #> $ age              <dbl> 53, 19, 52, 38, 57, 17, 18, 16, 15, 40, 33, 55, 5, 18… #> $ BT               <chr> "B2", "B2", "B4", "B1", "B2", "B1", "B1", "B1", "B2",… #> $ remission        <chr> "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR",… #> $ CR               <chr> "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR", "CR",… #> $ date.cr          <chr> "8/6/1997", "6/27/2000", "8/17/1998", "9/8/1997", "9/… #> $ `t(4;11)`        <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, NA, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, F… #> $ `t(9;22)`        <lgl> TRUE, FALSE, NA, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, F… #> $ cyto.normal      <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, NA, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, … #> $ citog            <chr> "t(9;22)", "simple alt.", NA, "t(4;11)", "del(6q)", "… #> $ mol.biol         <chr> "BCR/ABL", "NEG", "BCR/ABL", "ALL1/AF4", "NEG", "NEG"… #> $ `fusion protein` <chr> "p210", NA, "p190", NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, "p190", "… #> $ mdr              <chr> "NEG", "POS", "NEG", "NEG", "NEG", "NEG", "POS", "NEG… #> $ kinet            <chr> "dyploid", "dyploid", "dyploid", "dyploid", "dyploid"… #> $ ccr              <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALS… #> $ relapse          <lgl> FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE… #> $ transplant       <lgl> TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE… #> $ f.u              <chr> "BMT / DEATH IN CR", "REL", "REL", "REL", "REL", "REL… #> $ `date last seen` <chr> NA, "8/28/2000", "10/15/1999", "1/23/1998", "11/4/199… count(all, sex) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   sex       n #>   <chr> <int> #> 1 F        42 #> 2 M        83 #> 3 NA        3 all |>     count(sex) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   sex       n #>   <chr> <int> #> 1 F        42 #> 2 M        83 #> 3 NA        3 all |>     filter(sex == "F") |>     count(mol.biol) #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   mol.biol     n #>   <chr>    <int> #> 1 ALL1/AF4     5 #> 2 BCR/ABL     16 #> 3 E2A/PBX1     1 #> 4 NEG         19 #> 5 NUP-98       1 all |>     filter(!is.na(sex)) |>     count(sex, mol.biol) #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    sex   mol.biol     n #>    <chr> <chr>    <int> #>  1 F     ALL1/AF4     5 #>  2 F     BCR/ABL     16 #>  3 F     E2A/PBX1     1 #>  4 F     NEG         19 #>  5 F     NUP-98       1 #>  6 M     ALL1/AF4     5 #>  7 M     BCR/ABL     21 #>  8 M     E2A/PBX1     3 #>  9 M     NEG         53 #> 10 M     p15/p16      1 all |>     filter(         !is.na(sex),         mol.biol %in% c("BCR/ABL", "NEG")     ) |>     count(sex, mol.biol) |>     tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = "mol.biol", values_from = "n") #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   sex   `BCR/ABL`   NEG #>   <chr>     <int> <int> #> 1 F            16    19 #> 2 M            21    53

title: Day 2: Data Management, Statistical Analysis, and Visualization
text: Summarization – count, mean, variance Classical statistics – t-tests, linear regression Survival analysis
code: all |>     filter(!is.na(age)) |>     summarize(n = n(), ave_age = mean(age)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>       n ave_age #>   <int>   <dbl> #> 1   123    32.4 all |>     filter(!is.na(age)) |>     group_by(sex) |>     summarize(n = n(), ave_age = mean(age)) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   sex       n ave_age #>   <chr> <int>   <dbl> #> 1 F        42    35.2 #> 2 M        81    30.9

title: Day 2: Data Management, Statistical Analysis, and Visualization
text: Box plot  Scatter plot Linear regression
code: library(ggplot2) all_subset <-     all |>     filter(         !is.na(age),         mol.biol %in% c("BCR/ABL", "NEG")     ) ggplot(all_subset) +     aes(x = sex, y = age) +     geom_boxplot()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Morgan M (2024). RPG520: Course Material: Principles Computational Oncology. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://mtmorgan.github.io/RPG520/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {RPG520: Course Material: Principles of Computational Oncology},   author = {Martin Morgan},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://mtmorgan.github.io/RPG520/}, }
